page.title: 11 Salt marsh deposits
page.content: The parts of the marsh above the high water mark are composed of silty clay deposited by the river. This has hardened as it has dried and is now quite firm.It has oxidised to a dark reddish colour.The sides of the large channels are composed of fine mud,the surface of which has oxidised to a light brown colour.When disturbed this reveals the deep black colour typical of the oxygen scarce reducing conditions of marsh deposits.The floors of these large channels are disected by meandering micro-channels. The type of deposition in these obviously varies with the state of the tidal regime. At low tide the top 3 to 4 cms consist of very fine oily black mud probably deposited at low velocity by the last water in the channel.However beneath the mud are pea size grits deposited by faster flows.
